chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Hetzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

supervisions.notes: NO objection to transfer of probation or jail to Wood County.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or a combination.  When not fully engaged, must complete 15 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Counseling as recommended including sex offender counseling and treatment.  

Register as sex offender for 15 years.  

DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: STAY 5 months and 10 days.  SERVE 20 days with huber for work/school/treatment/child care or combination.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Hetzel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 8:37 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Richard Lawson;
PRELIMINARY HEARING:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime)>> DRI.
Ct. 3 (Resisting an Officer)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Child Enticement-Sexual Contact)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2 (Child Enticement-Sexual Contact)>> Sentence W/H- 5 Years Probation. CONDITIONS: Impose 6 Months MCJ, Stay 5 Months and 10 Days MCJ, Serve 20 days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment/child care or a combination, Counseling as recommended including Sex Offender Counseling, Sex Offender Treatment, Register with Sex Offender Registry for 15 Years, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 3 days credit. Defendant has 45 days to report to MCJ. No objection to EMP. No objection for probation transfer to Wood County or Jail time being served in Wood County.

Adjourned: 9:00 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on July 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on May 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.

AMENDED $10,000.00 SIGNATURE W/ FIRST $3,000.00 CASH   No contact with females under 18 years of age EXCEPT step daughter if supervised by someone 25 years of age or older.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No computer or internet access-only use smart phone for calls and text (no internet) but may be present in room while wife is on the computer, but defendant may not have direct use of the computer or internet at any time.

AMENDED $10,000.00 SIGNATURE W/ FIRST $3,000.00 CASH   No contact with females under 18 years of age EXCEPT step daughter if supervised by someone 25 years of age or older.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No computer or internet access-only use smart phone for calls and text (no internet) but may be present in room while wife is on the computer, but defendant may not have direct use of the computer or internet at any time.

Case Called: 10:34 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Richard Lawson. 
Date and time set to Modify Bond Conditions. 
The bond conditions of No contact with Females under 18 including the step daughter and no access to computers or internet are being argued at this time.
Atty Lawson makes argument. State would object any bond modification.
COURT MODIFIES BOND:
COURT allows defendant to have contact with step daughter when supervised by someone 25 years or older. Defendant may be present in the room while wife is on the computer, but Defendant may not have direct use the computer or internet at any time. 
Adj: 10:38 am
